definition: Arbor Day (March 12th), also known as National Tree Planting Day 全民義務植樹日|全民义务植树日[Quan2 min2 Yi4 wu4 Zhi2 shu4 ri4]
to plant
tree/CL:棵[ke1]/to cultivate/to set up
festival/holiday/node/joint/section/segment/part/to economize/to save/to abridge/moral integrity/classifier for segments, e.g. lessons, train wagons, biblical verses/CL:個|个[ge4]
see 節骨眼|节骨眼[jie1 gu5 yan3]

sentences.english: Not all the students went to plant trees on Tree Planting Day.
sentences.chinese: 植樹節那天並非所有的學生都去栽樹了。

sentences.english: In different countries, Planting Trees Days are on different days.
sentences.chinese: 在不同國家，植樹節在不同的日子。

sentences.english: Today is Arbor Day What are you going to do?
sentences.chinese: 今天是植樹節，你有什麼打算嗎？

sentences.english: Last Arbor Day I planted two trees.
sentences.chinese: 上年的植樹節，我種了兩棵樹。

sentences.english: As years go by, Arbor Day has become of the major holidays in America.
sentences.chinese: 隨着時間流逝，植樹節已經成爲美國的主要節日之一。

sentences.english: Later on, each American state started to celebrate Arbor Day.
sentences.chinese: 後來，其它州也跟進，開始慶祝植樹節。

sentences.english: Today is Arbor Day. What are you going to do?
sentences.chinese: 今天是植樹節，你有什麼打算嗎？

sentences.english: In China, Planting Trees Day is on March 12.
